graphicslib3D.editors

Class QuarterPatchDialogPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • graphicslib3D.editors.QuarterPatchDialogPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class QuarterPatchDialogPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This helper class implements the visual functionality of the QuarterPatchDialog class by providing mouse listeners, painting algorithms, and methods to manually move a point via scrollbars or textboxes.
    Version:
    1.1 09/02/03
    Author:
    Matt Gross.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getSurfaceControlPoints

        public Point3D[][] getSurfaceControlPoints()
        Returns the 4x4 array holding the control points defining the quarter-surface (that is, the 16 control points derived from the 4 "profile curve" control points.
        Returns:
        Point3D [4][4] containing the surface control points

      • Undo

        public void Undo()
        Will restore a point to its original location before it was dragged by the mouse.

      • updateSelectedPoint

        public boolean updateSelectedPoint(double newVal,
                                   int XYorZ)
        Updates an attribute of a point only if it its isSelected value is true. The XYorZ parameter determines which parameter is to be changed: 0=change x, 1=change y. If none of the points have been selected, false is returned.

      • getZoom

        public double getZoom()
        Returns zoom factor in double form.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double newZoom)
        Sets the zoom factor; a value of 1.0 means no zoom, a value of 2.0 means double zoom factor, and a value of .5 means 1/2 zoom factor

      • setShowSecondaryAxis

        public void setShowSecondaryAxis(boolean status)
        Sets whether secondary axis should be displayed or not.

      • refreshView

        public void refreshView()
        Forces repaint of sweptPatchDialogPanel.

      • SplitToLeftRight

        public void SplitToLeftRight(Point3D[][] newLeft,
                             Point3D[][] newRight,
                             Point3D[][] original)
        Function to split the mesh into left and right pieces. This function only works for Bezier patches, and must be replaced if using a B-spline.

      • SplitToTopBottom

        public void SplitToTopBottom(Point3D[][] newLower,
                             Point3D[][] newUpper,
                             Point3D[][] original)
        Function to split the mesh into top and bottom pieces. This function only works for Bezier patches, and must be replaced if using a B-spline.

        All objects of the panel are painted here.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent m)
        Updates a point's location if one is selected. Also takes in account the angle of the camera when moving a point to assure that moving the mouse in an upward direction will always give a "positive" value.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
